alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 21 at 11:06AM PST until December 21 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHEASTERN SANTA BARBARA COUNTY... ...DANGEROUS FLOODING IN THE CITY OF SANTA BARBARA AND VICINITY... At 1106 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that light to moderate was falling across the warned area, after heavier rains occurred earlier this morning. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.75 to 1 inch per hour, at times. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area into the afternoon. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. Significant landslides and other debris flows. SOURCE...Santa Barbara County Emergency Management, law enforcement, radar, and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Santa Barbara, Montecito, Santa Ynez, Carpinteria, Isla Vista, Summerland, El Capitan State Beach, Refugio State Beach, Goleta, Highway 154 over San Marcos Pass, Mission Canyon, Santa Barbara Air[port, Hope Ranch, Lake Cachuma, and Old Man Mountain. Flood waters have entered several buildings and homes in the city of Santa Barbara. Multiple streets and highways have been flooded and closed. While light to moderate rains continue, the heaviest rain has temporarily ended as of late this morning. However, by afternoon, additional heavy rain may move into the region, causing the flooding to continue. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.75-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Flooding and debris flows are imminent or occurring.
